We should not confuse 'realistic' with 'theoretically possible'.

realistic (comparative more realistic, superlative most realistic)

  • Expressed or represented as being accurate.
    A realistic appraisal of the situation.
  • Relating to the representation of objects, actions or conditions as they actually are or were.
    A realistic novel about the Victorian poor.

It is theoretically possible that broken vase pieces will jump off ground, snap together to form an unbroken vase, and land back on table. But it is not realistic to expect that it will happen and it is not realistic to build a rocket engine based on that principle.
